job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
JOB&nbsp;DESCRIPTION   Site&nbsp;Reliability&nbsp;Engineer:   As&nbsp;an&nbsp;Engineer&nbsp;in&nbsp;the&nbsp;Retail&nbsp;and&nbsp;Athlete&nbsp;Tools&nbsp;team,&nbsp;you&nbsp;will&nbsp;be&nbsp;passionate&nbsp;about&nbsp;maximum&nbsp;availability,&nbsp;observability,&nbsp;reliability,&nbsp;security,&nbsp;and&nbsp;performance&nbsp;of&nbsp;Client’sDigital Experiences in Stores and in our Digital call centers around the globe! You will&nbsp;build applications, tools, and automation using your technical skills to provide deep&nbsp;problem analysis, detect system faults or code defects, define, report, write and build&nbsp;observability processes for critical metrics, and partner up with product delivery teams&nbsp;to provide long term scalable solutions to production issues!   We&nbsp;are looking&nbsp;for hardworking engineers&nbsp;who can bring&nbsp;the following:     - Ability to observe, diagnose, code, and test fixes for production issues quickly and&nbsp;efficiently   
  - Ability to develop and drive real-time supervising solutions that provide transparency&nbsp;into site health and key performance indicators   
  - Strong communication skills are written and verbal with the ability to articulate issues and&nbsp;their&nbsp;impact(s), write concise runbooks, and give technical demo’s   
  - Capable of reporting and communicating metrics with an understanding of the&nbsp;business landscape and how site reliability influences our consumers   
  - Working&nbsp;understanding&nbsp;of&nbsp;IT&nbsp;service&nbsp;management&nbsp;(Incident,&nbsp;Problem,&nbsp;Change&nbsp;and&nbsp;Knowledge management)   
  - Ability to work across teams (business and technical) to continuously analyze system&nbsp;performance, seek for avoidance/root-cause, and proactively identify areas in need of&nbsp;optimization   
  - Passion for continuous learning, partnership, and teamwork   
   Qualifications:     - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or another relevant subject area   
  - 1-2 years of professional experience in software development, testing, and/or DevOps engineering.   
   Career:     - Design and development experience with microservice-based architecture in Java,&nbsp;Node.js, or similar language preferred   
  - Design and development experience with front-end UI languages such as Javascript,&nbsp;React, Swift, or similar preferred   
  - Experience&nbsp;building,&nbsp;deploying,&nbsp;and&nbsp;supporting&nbsp;cloud-based&nbsp;systems&nbsp;in&nbsp;AWS&nbsp;preferred   
  - Experience with at least one database layer such as SQL, DynamoDb, Cassandra,&nbsp;etc.   
  - Understanding of basic network and infrastructure concepts such as DNS,&nbsp;Virtualization,&nbsp;Linux   
  - Experience with Docker and/or Serverless patterns a plus   
  - Experience with observability monitoring tools such as Splunk, SignalFx, New Relic,&nbsp;or Catchpoint is a plus   
  - Background with ITIL or Lean a plus.
